cashFlow.label: Cash Flow
cashFlow.tooltip: free cash flow for last year

futureYears.label: Future Years
futureYears.tooltip: future years considered in the calculation

discountRate.label: Discount Rate
discountRate.tooltip: annual expected profit for future years considered

growthRate.label: Company Growth Rate
growthRate.tooltip: annual company growth rate for future years considered

tv.label: Long Term Growth Rate (TV)
tv.tooltip: long term company growth rate, after the considered future years (Terrminal Value)

tpe.label: Terminal PE
tpe.tooltip: expected PE after range years considered (after 20 years)

growthRatePeRatio.tooltip:
Lynch says: in general a P/E ratio that's half the growth rate
is very positive and one that's twice the growth rate is very negative. Talking about growth rate of earnings (net income), here.

growthRatePeRatioFwd.tooltip: Same of above except for P/E forward used in the ratio calculation.

dividendYield.tooltip: ratio between last price and last dividend value

growthRatePeRatioDividend.tooltip: slightly more complicated: adds dividend yield to the earnings growth rate and divide by P/E, result less than 1 is poor, 1.5 is okay but we looking for 2 or better

growthRatePeFwdRatioDividend.tooltip: Same of above except for P/E forward used in the ratio calculation.
